product_summary:
Shumai is a fast, network-connected, differentiable tensor library for TypeScript (and JavaScript).  Built with bun + flashlight for software engineers and researchers alike. With support for ArrayFire, users can leverage GPU computation. 

The library offers standard array utilities, easy conversion to and from JavaScript native arrays, gradient computation, and profiling capabilities. 

Shumai aims to make creating datasets easier, training small models faster, and advanced/fine-grained training/inference logic more expressive, all while building applications enjoyable with the use of the JavaScript ecosystem.
product_pros: Fast and efficient, leverages ArrayFire for GPU computation
Easy conversion to and from JavaScript native arrays
Supports building full applications with the JavaScript ecosystem
product_cons: Limited support for non-ArrayFire tensor backends (currently only CPU computation with ArrayFire)
May not be suitable for large-scale deep learning models
Documentation and community support may be limited compared to more established frameworks
May require some expertise in JavaScript and TypeScript for effective usage
Performance may vary depending on the underlying hardware and configuration

product_usecases.details: Shumai is well-suited for training and deploying small-scale deep learning models due to its speed and efficiency.
Shumai can be seamlessly integrated into JavaScript applications, allowing developers to leverage machine learning capabilities within their web or server-side applications.
The ease of use and quick setup of Shumai make it an excellent choice for rapid prototyping and exploring machine learning concepts.
Shumai's simplicity and educational resources make it a valuable tool for teaching and learning about deep learning.
Shumai's ability to run on resource-constrained devices, such as Raspberry Pi, makes it suitable for edge computing applications.

product_toolfor.details: Shumai provides a familiar and efficient environment for software engineers proficient in JavaScript and TypeScript to develop machine learning applications.
Shumai's flexibility and customization options make it a valuable tool for researchers exploring new deep learning algorithms and architectures.
Shumai enables data scientists to quickly prototype and deploy machine learning models using JavaScript, a language they may already be familiar with.
Shumai allows web developers to add machine learning capabilities to their web applications without the need for extensive machine learning expertise.
Shumai's ease of use and educational resources make it accessible to hobbyists and enthusiasts interested in learning about and experimenting with deep learning.

product_pricing: Shumai is an open-source library available under the MIT license. It is free to use and does not require any subscription or licensing fees.
